 A tough question. Starting at the bottom of the list, I'd have to eliminate those who obviously have a slippery grasp on all reality. Then I'd strike blatant bible thumpers for the same reason (though an agnostic, I do respect the beliefs of others). Anyone who blindly supports our crusade in Iraq wouldn't have too many original or rational thoughts on that subject and probably many others, so scratch them. That doesn't include those with strong military attachment and/or affiliation, I understand those conditions. Politics are interesting, but not a reason to exclude anyone unless they're such party dogs it approaches a belief system. 
 
 That leaves a big group of people I'd like to meet. From there I'd cut it by Americans and non-Americans, simply because I'm very familiar with most conceited American train of thoughts and enjoy new information. At that point, I'd have to examine age, education and other sociodemographic factors. After all that, if it came down to a tie, I'd pick a woman because they generally provide better conversation with different insight than men. Are there any female posters who fit that description? Otherwise, make it a group meeting without the irrational posters in attendance.

I'm not ticked off at anybody (on 4forums). I think the absense of voice inflections and facial expressions associated with typed messages may lead people to think I'm ticked, but I very seldom get that way.
 
 If it won't burn your ears (profanity) you can go to...
 
 http://www.politicalforums.net/index.php?showtopic=8479
 
 ...to find my true sentiments. Check the link in post#8 and read through that lengthy thread looking for Stalin and Eight-Ball (avatars) in particular. It picks up around post#33. I REALLY ticked him off!
 
 Sometimes it seems to me that the sensitive ones on here appear to be really ticked at me, but...(a)I'm not certain that they are and (b)I don't care if indeed they are. :p 
 
 As previously stated, just because I name a few people I'd like to meet doesn't mean I don't want to meet the others. The list would be entirely too long for me to type and copying the members list would be meaningless.
 
 It would be fun to meet the people I've been abrasive with, but I believe I split the party on that factor. I don't recall epaphras_faith ever having been abrasive or arrogant. Jitobear is a firecracker, but I don't recall her being abrasive with me. I've had less cyber-conflict with you than with daewoo and Waxy... sglain is an okay guy, too. I'm relatively sure that everybody I named has some redeeming values...even the liberals.
 
 Two of the best ways to create pseudo-enemies are to talk politics and talk religion. That's basically what the site is about.
 
 I've had a lot of fun since I found this site...and I've learned a few things to boot. emoticon_xhoho 
 
 @sinjin:
 
 If you really want some tamales, PM me an address that Fedex or UPS will deliver to. It may be a medium while before you get them, but they'll be edible without concern for any kind of trickery or poisoning. If it's close enough, I might deliver them myself and act as the King's taster.

I would like to meet just about everybody here. If I had to pick just 5 it would likely be:
 
 GeorgeD
 Big Orn
 Jims trucking
 Billsco
 Alan ryan
 Lord Tammerlin
 
 Ok, that is 6. Close enough.
 
 I have not always agreed with the people on the above list, but they seem to be the kind of folks that a guy could sit down with and tip back a few.
 
 And jim, we do not have empires in the midwest. That is an old money east coast concept. In the midwest, the best you can really do (witht he exception of the mob, which does have an empire) is to carve out your own little fifedom. I don't even have a fifedom. I have 2 sections in Lyon county. That is my kingdom. I have to resort to favors, bribing, and backscratching of officials on neiboring kingdoms to get anything done. 
 
 As far as tamales go.....on the subject of mexican food.....I had the most incredible mexican feast last weekend. I went to a party being thrown by a firend of mine, a mexican emmigrant who is a truck driver for the BNSF. He took a 200 lb hog, gutted it, skinned it, dug a pit in the ground about 3 ft deep. He loaded the pit with charcoal about 8" deep, then lit it an put a big piece of clean sheet metal over the coals. Hog went on the sheet metal, antoher piece of sheet metal on top, more coals and some dirt. Let roast for 2 days.
 
 He stuffed the hog with a huge numebr of pepper (jalapeno, poblano, hot lemon, fatalii, and fluorecent purple). When he finally dug up the hog, the meat was falling off the bone. they shredded the whole thing into a big couldren over a hot coal bed (to keep it hot), added some chopped jalapeno and firecracker chili peppers, and served it with fried rice, refried beans, and home made tortillas. It was absolutly incredible. 
 
 Just thought I would let you know what those tamales have to contend with. So far, that little feast last weekend, eaten around an open camp fire while we passed around bottles of the best tequila I have ever tasted, holds the title as far as best mexican food I have ever eaten
